title: 6 Top Places To Visit In Laos You Should Not Miss
text:
Home > Travel Destinations > 6 Top Places To Visit In Laos You Should Not Miss 6 Top Places To Visit In Laos You Should Not Miss By admin on July 30, 2015 Pin It 
Laos is a landlocked and a mountainous country located in South East Asia. Travelers take a tour to this country to experience the laid-back lifestyle of this place. Visiting Laos is very close to taking a trip back in time. 
Vientiane, the capital of Laos is a riverfront town that has a relaxed atmosphere. People are drawn to this place for its beauty and also because of the fact that the country lies isolated from the outside world. 
Recently, there has been an increase in the number of bridges and roads built in this country. This has made the tourist attractions of the place more accessible. Top Places To Visit In Laos During Visit 
Some of the top places to visit in Laos, which you should not miss during your visit are included below: Luang Prabang 
Luang Prabang served as the ancient capital of Laos and it is also listed in the UNESCO World Heritage Site. This tourist spot in Laos serves as the essence of tranquility and charm. 
The city is positioned at the confluence of the Khan and the Mekong rivers and it surrounded by splendid scenery of colorful flowers, waterfalls (Tat Sea waterfalls and Kuang Si Falls), sacred caves (Pak Ou Caves) and mountains. Vang Vieng 
The village called Vang Vieng is located on the edge of the Nam Song River and it is surrounded by green countryside. One of the most beautiful attractions of this village is its local caves. You can also visit Vang Xang, the popular archaeological site dating back to the 11th century. Mekong River 
Next one of the top places to visit in Laos is Mekong River, which is the greatest river in Southeast Asia. The length of this river is 4350 kms with Laos having the greatest share of this river. The Mekong River is the most important means of transportation is Laos. Si Phan Don 
Si Phan Don is a gorgeous set of islands with the background being the scenic part of Mekong River. There are three important islands catering to the tourists at Si Phan Don and they are Done Kong Kong, Don Khone and Don Det. Pakse 
Pakse is the only chief town that lies in southern Laos. South Laos is fertile and flat which is very different from North Laos which is mountainous. While in Pakse, you should not miss Wat Phu, which is a ruined Khmer Hindu temple complex and also a UNESCO World heritage site. 
You will find tropical palms and verdant landscapes in Pakse which is located on the meeting point of the Don and the Mekong rivers. Luang Namtha 
Luang Namtha is one of the top places to visit in Laos, which attracts many tourists who love trekking and biking. This is the largest settlement in the northern Laos, which lies on the banks of river Nam Tha. Luang Namtha stupa , night market, etc are some of the places of interest in this area.
